column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: New Hampshire
column6: NH

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column6: increases reaction time.
column8: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.

column2: 2. When parallel parking between two cars, you should first:
column4: back slowly.
column6: pull up even with the front car.
column8: turn your wheels to the right.
column10: turn your wheels to the left.

column2: 3. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.
column6: low clearance.

column2: 4. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They are hard to see in traffic.
column6: They don’t have rearview mirrors.

column2: 5. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column10: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 6. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.

column2: 7. Smoking while driving:
column4: does not affect driving abilities.
column6: is not distracting.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Multiple Turns
column6: Winding road

column2: 9. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: at any time.
column6: when making turns.
column10: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 10. When passing another vehicle:
column4: there is no need to signal.
column6: honk your horn repeatedly to warn the other driver.
column8: you can exceed the posted speed limit.
column10: pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.

column2: 11. The picture shows:
column4: a no-right-turn sign.
column6: a reversible road sign.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Left lane must turn left
column6: T-intersection ahead

column2: 13. You may pass another vehicle:
column4: on a curve or a hill.
column6: when there is a solid yellow line on your side.
column8: on the shoulder of the highway.

column2: 14. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: pump your brakes to get them to back off.
column6: slow down to encourage the tailgater to pass.
column10: speed up to increase the space between you and the tailgater.

column2: 15. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column6: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column8: the type of route you are on.
column10: the speed limit on that route.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway begins
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 17. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Round
column6: Pentagon

column2: 18. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 19. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 20. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: drive in the right lane only.
column10: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.

column2: 21. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 22. Worn tires:
column4: can increase your stopping distance.
column6: can make turning more difficult.
column8: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.

column2: 23. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 24. Traffic signs and pavement markings must be:
column4: used as a guide only.
column6: followed only when other vehicles are present.
column10: followed only when a police officer is present.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Steep grade ahead
column6: Wrong Way

column2: 26. Tailgating:
column4: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
column6: cannot result in a traffic citation.

column2: 27. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: can not turn left.
column6: must turn into its left lane.
column8: must go to the next intersection.
column10: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 28. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Rounabout ahead.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 29. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column6: you can reduce fuel consumption.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 30. A work zone:
column4: does not require that the driver slow down and pay extra attention.
column6: might involve vehicles and moving workers.
column8: is marked with black and white signs.

column2: 31. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: parking lights.
column6: high beam lights.

column2: 32. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: keep your eyes moving.
column6: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 33. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column6: Railroad advance warning signs (round)

column2: 34. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column6: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column8: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.

column2: 35. When are you allowed to drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway?
column4: Never.
column6: Only if you ride in the back of a pick-up truck.
column8: As long as you don’t drive.
column10: Only if you ride in the back seat.

column2: 36. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 37. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column6: must cross the intersection immdiately.
column8: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column10: must always come to a complete stop.

column2: 38. This warning sign:
column4: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column10: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.

column2: 39. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: low beam headlights.
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 40. This sign means:
column4: Speeding is not allowed
column6: You must yield the right-of-way ahead
